source_articles.title: Solana and BNB Chain Stablecoin Supply Hits Record Highs - Bitget
source_articles.body:
The supply of stablecoins on Solana and BNB Chain has hit new highs, indicating a revival in decentralized finance (DeFi). On-chain analyses show that Solana’s stablecoin supply reached $15.3 billion, while BNB Chain’s stablecoin supply was close behind at $13.9 billion for both networks to achieve all-time highs.
The uptick in supply also represents a growth in confidence by investors into DeFi ecosystems built on blockchain networks like BNB chain and Solana. Stablecoins are a digital asset that is pegged to the value of fiat currency and are becoming increasingly important liquidity tools for decentralized exchanges or yield protocols in the same way as fiat currency is being used in traditional financial liquidity. The increase in supplies on Solana and BNB chain reflects the larger recovery of on-chain activity after a several months long consolidation period in price.
As adoption of cryptocurrency continues to push forward, there are other deeper trends involved in these record numbers. Developers and users are galvanizing toward scalable and low-fee networks with faster transaction times, which is contributing to even more stablecoin activity toward Solana and BNB chain.
🚨BREAKING: $SOL & $BNB Chain stablecoin supply just hit ATHs! $SOL 's stablecoin supply just hit a record $15.3B, while $BNB Chain surged to $13.9B. pic.twitter.com/kgCy8D5WyR
— Coin Bureau (@coinbureau) October 8, 2025
The rapid growth of Solana and BNB Chain stablecoin supply is not just a number, it’s a clear indicator of DeFi market growth. When stablecoin circulation increases, it often suggests higher on-chain liquidity and trading volume.
In Solana’s case, its efficient architecture and low transaction costs have made it a preferred network for stablecoin-based applications. Developers are building DeFi platforms that rely on instant settlement and minimal fees, both strong advantages Solana provides.
Similarly, BNB Chain continues to attract liquidity through a robust ecosystem of decentralized applications (dApps). From lending platforms to yield farms, its stablecoin activity reflects both user engagement and market depth. This liquidity expansion is critical for sustaining DeFi growth in the coming quarters.
Several factors explain why the Solana and BNB Chain stablecoin supply has soared to record levels. First, institutional participation in stablecoin-based DeFi products has grown steadily throughout 2025. Hedge funds and trading firms now see stablecoins as efficient tools for liquidity management and on-chain yield.
Moreover, the environment for blockchain liquidity is also shifting. More users are bridging assets cross-chain and moving stablecoins to faster networks like Solana and BNB Chain, which is one way the cross-chain process arises to allow users to earn diversification of risk exposure while providing new opportunities to earn a return through DeFi applications, which are now mildly popular.
Finally, digital asset price recovery has generally been a confidence restoration for decentralized systems. As Bitcoin and Ethereum have exhibited price resiliency, traders are starting to deploy stablecoins into DeFi pools at a stable return, ultimately helping liquidity demand in a feedback loop.
While both Solana and BNB Chain have achieved record-breaking stablecoin levels, their growth paths differ. Solana’s ecosystem has benefited from technical innovation and major partnerships that brought liquidity to its DeFi protocols. Its fast confirmation times make it ideal for real-time financial applications.
BNB Chain, on the other hand, has leveraged Binance’s global reach to attract millions of retail and institutional users. Its compatibility with Ethereum’s tools has made migration easy for developers seeking high throughput and lower costs.
Together, they represent the new wave of DeFi market growth, bridging traditional finance and blockchain innovation. The competition between these two chains continues to push the boundaries of wha

source_articles.title: Forward Industries Strengthens Solana Ecosystem with Validator Launch - CoinTrust
source_articles.body:
Forward Industries Inc. (NASDAQ: FORD), a treasury company with a strategic focus on the Solana blockchain, announced the activation of its institutional-grade validator node on Solana in collaboration with DoubleZero, a blockchain infrastructure provider specializing in performance optimization. The move marks a significant step in the company’s transition from a capital allocator to a key participant in Solana’s technical ecosystem.
According to the company, the validator node is already operational on DoubleZero’s infrastructure and has been developed in association with Galaxy, leveraging Jump Crypto’s Firedancer client to achieve greater speed and scalability. Designed to meet institutional standards, the validator aims to strengthen Solana’s overall throughput and efficiency while advancing the blockchain’s readiness for large-scale financial applications.
Forward Industries has set the validator’s commission rate at zero percent, allowing holders of Solana’s native token, SOL, to delegate their stake to the company’s node at no additional cost. The firm has also confirmed that all of its own SOL holdings are staked through this validator. Future validators planned by Forward are expected to be deployed exclusively on DoubleZero’s network, reinforcing a unified and high-performance architecture across its operations.
Institutional-grade infrastructure for decentralized networks
The collaboration between Forward Industries and DoubleZero extends beyond validator deployment. Both organizations are jointly conducting pilot programs aimed at improving network revenue optimization, increasing bandwidth, and minimizing latency. These efforts are expected to further enhance Solana’s reliability and position it as a preferred choice for institutional and enterprise blockchain solutions.
At launch, Forward’s validator is projected to rank among the top ten Solana validators globally, underscoring the firm’s growing influence within the blockchain community. The company’s leadership has emphasized that the strength of decentralized networks depends on achieving enterprise-level standards of performance, scalability, and security. Forward has highlighted that its partnership with DoubleZero, Galaxy, and the Firedancer development team reflects a shared commitment to reinforcing Solana’s resilience and ensuring its continued adoption across the decentralized finance (DeFi) sector.

In a related development, Forward Industries reported in September that it had completed a private investment in public equity (PIPE) transaction, raising approximately $1.65 billion before fees and expenses. The company stated that the funds would primarily support the creation of its cryptocurrency treasury operations, emphasizing the accumulation of SOL tokens as a core component of its strategy. Additional capital will be directed toward operational expenses, working capital, and upcoming investment opportunities tied to the Solana network.
The PIPE financing also attracted participation from several global investment firms, asset managers, and notable angel investors across the digital asset landscape. This widespread interest has been interpreted as an indicator of growing institutional confidence in both Solana’s long-term viability and Forward Industries’ approach to fostering its ecosystem.

Cosmo Jiang, General Partner at Pantera Capital and Board Observer, noted the company is “focused on maximizing shareholder value by efficiently accumulating Solana.”
Institutional Solana treasury holdings have surged past $4 billion across 18 tracked participants controlling 3.1% of the circulating supply, according to Strategic Solana Reserve data.

Multi-Billion Dollar Treasury Commitments Drive Corporate Adoption

source_articles.title: Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) Live May 30: On-Again, Off-Again Tariffs Are On Again, Dow Index Slumps - AOL.com
source_articles.body:
Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) Live May 30: On-Again, Off-Again Tariffs Are On Again, Dow Index Slumps
This article will be updated throughout the day, so check back often for more daily updates.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJINDICES: ^DJI) closed up 0.3% on Thursday, but is already giving back those gains in pre-market trading -- down 0.3%. Investors seemed happy to hear, yesterday morning, that a U.S. trade court had decided to order President Trump to lift most of the tariffs he announced in April. But by evening the joy had faded, as the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit stepped in to grant a temporary restraining order preventing the tariffs from being lifted.
So the on-again, off-again tariffs are right back "on again" -- and in fact, could be even more "on" than we thought last night.
This morning, in a post on Truth Social, the President accused China of having "TOTALLY VIOLATED" a trade agreement under which the President had cut China tariffs from 145% to 30% earlier this month. "So much for being Mr. NICE GUY!," posted the President, apparently threatening to raise tariffs even higher.
How high will tariffs go? No one knows, but investors are already spooked and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) is predictably slumping in response.
Earnings
Dell Technologies (NYSE: DELL) and Costco (Nasdaq: COST) both reported earnings after close of trading last night. Dell's earnings were "mixed," with a Q1 sales beat but an earnings miss. On the plus side, Dell said both sales and earnings in Q2 will be better.
Costco's report featured top-and-bottom line beats for that company's fiscal Q3.

source_articles.title: Wall Street today: US stocks fall as focus shifts to Fed policy cues - Mint
source_articles.body:
US stocks fell on Tuesday, following a record-breaking performance the previous day, which saw both the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq indices reach new closing highs.
The market’s attention has now decisively shifted towards a series of Federal Reserve speakers who are due to provide fresh indications regarding the future direction of monetary policy. Investors are closely awaiting these statements for cues on interest rates and the overall economic outlook.
As of noon Eastern Time, the S&P 500 dipped 0.4%, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.3%, and the Nasdaq Composite was 0.7% lower.
As of 9:35 a.m. Eastern Time, the S&P 500 rose 0.2%, the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 0.3%, and the Nasdaq Composite was 0.2% higher.
At the open, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 5.9 points, or 0.01%, to 46,700.9. The S&P 500 rose 5.9 points, or 0.09%, to 6,746.14, while the Nasdaq Composite rose 30.7 points, or 0.13%, to 22,972.369.
In the bond market, the yield on the 10-year Treasury fell to 4.15% from 4.18% late on Monday.
Shares of IBM surged 3% after announcing a partnership that will integrate Anthropic’s Claude AI chatbot into some of IBM’s software products.
A day after Advanced Micro Devices stock rallied on a deal with OpenAI, AMD climbed another 6.6% on Tuesday.
Constellation Brands stock climbed 5.6% after the beer and wine company reported better than expected third quarter results.
Ford stock tumbled 5.4% following a fire in an Oswego, New York aluminum plant that is expected to reduce supplies to the auto giant for months.
Gold prices continued its record-breaking rally on Tuesday, hovering just $22 shy of the $4,000 per ounce milestone, driven by persistent safe-haven demand amid the ongoing US government shutdown.
Spot gold rose 0.4% to $3,978.01 per ounce by 0923 a.m. ET (1323 GMT), after hitting an all-time high of $3,985.48 earlier in the session.
US gold futures for December delivery added 0.6% to $4,000.90.
Among other metals, spot silver fell 0.4% at $48.31 per ounce, platinum lost 0.1% to $1,624.63 and palladium edged up 1.6% at $1,340.68.
Oil prices saw a decline on Tuesday as investor sentiment was dampened by concerns over possible market oversupply. The slight drop occurred even as analysts weighed the recently announced OPEC output rise for November, which was smaller than market expectations.
Brent crude futures fell 39 cents, or 0.6%, to $65.08 a barrel at 1321 GMT. US West Texas Intermediate crude lost 38 cents, or 0.62%, to $61.31.

source_articles.title: DAX Index analysis: Why German stocks are rising this year - CryptoRank
source_articles.body:
DAX Index analysis: Why German stocks are rising this year
The DAX Index has held steady in the past few days and is hovering at near its all-time high of €24,635. It was trading at €24,378 today, up by over 32% from its lowest level in April. This article highlights why the blue-chip German index is rising and the top movers this year.
Reasons why the DAX Index is soaring
There are three main reasons why the German DAX Index is in a strong rally this year. First, the rally is being supported by the actions of the European Central Bank (ECB), which has slashed interest rates several times and brought them to 2% this year.
It is common for the stock market to do well when the central bank is cutting interest rates as this makes the equities market more interesting than bonds.
The index has also reacted positively to the interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, which cut them by 0.25% in the last meeting in September. Analysts expect that the bank will cut interest rates again later this year.
The DAX Index has also jumped because of the general correlation with the other global indices like the Hang Seng, Dow Jones, and the S&P 500. Historically, these global indices have had a close correlation with each other.
Additionally, the index benefited from the increased government spending in Germany as officials sought to supercharge the economy.
The gains, however, have been limited by Donald Trump’s tariffs, which have applied on all goods that Germany sells to the United States, especially its vehicles. Trump has warned that he will add a 25% tariff on trucks, a move that will affect Daimler Trucks, one of the biggest players in the industry.
Porsche, the maker of luxury vehicles, has been one of the most affected companies by Donald Trump’s tariffs as the US is its only growing market. The most recent results showed that the Chinese business has continued to deteriorate, while Europe is not growing. Porsche makes all its vehicles in Germany, meaning that it has to pay more in tariffs than other manufacturers.
Top gainers and laggards in the German DAX
The top gainer in the DAX Index this year is Rheinmetall, the giant company in the defense industry whose shares have jumped by 207% this year amid increased defense spending.
Siemens Energy share price has soared by 112% this year and 211% in the last 12 months, making a spectacular comeback for a company that received a government bailout a few years ago. Its performance has happened because of the ongoing demand for power globally.
The Commerzbank share price has jumped by 100% this year, helped by the ongoing speculation that Unicredit will make a full bid for the company.
The other top gainers in the DAX Index this year are Deutsche Bank, Heidelberg Materials, Bayer, E. On, Fresenius, and RWE. On the other hand, the top laggards in the index are Symrise, Beiersdorf, Adidas, Zalando, and Merck.
DAX Index technical analysis
DAX chart | Source: TradingView
The daily timeframe chart shows that the DAX Index has rebounded in the past few days, moving from a low of 23,347 in September to a high of 24,400 today. It is now hovering near the year-to-date high of 24,635.
The index has remained above the 50-day and 100-day Exponential Moving Averages (EMA). It has also formed an ascending triangle pattern, which often leads to a strong bullish breakout over time.
Therefore, the most likely scenario is where it jumps in the coming weeks and hits the important resistance level at 25,000. A drop below the support at 24,000 will invalidate the bullish outlook.

source_articles.body:
Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures hold steady, gold gains ahead of Fed minutes
US stock futures edged higher on Wednesday as investors looked to the latest Federal Reserve minutes to provide insight into the economy amid a shutdown-driven dearth of data.
Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average (YM=F), the S&P 500 (ES=F), and the tech-dominated Nasdaq 100 (NQ=F) all moved up roughly 0.2%.
(YM=F)
The minutes from the Fed's September meeting due later in the day could offer new clues about the central bank’s internal divisions and the outlook for interest rates as the government shutdown deprives policymakers of key economic data.
Last week, the September jobs report wasn't released as scheduled by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. The figures would normally give investors a sense of the Fed's next moves, considering the labor market plays a central role in its policy decisions.
On Tuesday, all three major averages ended lower after reports of weaker-than-expected cloud margins at Oracle fueled fresh concerns about AI. The declines marked the end of a seven-day long winning streak for both the S&P 500 (^GSPC) and Nasdaq (^IXIC).
Gold (GC=F) futures continued to rise after topping $4,000 an ounce mark for the first time on Tuesday, marking a doubling in value in just two years. Prices have pushed higher amid fears over the US economy, accelerated recently by the federal government shutdown.
The federal stoppage, now in its seventh day, continues to breed uncertainty. So far, no end to the gridlock in Washington is in sight with President Trump backing Republicans' stance that no negotiations will be made with Democrats on the healthcare subsidies they hope to extend until the government is reopened. At the same time, Trump has threatened to withhold back pay for furloughed Federal workers.
LIVE 7 updates

source_articles.title: Stock Market Today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq Set to Open Up; Tesla, AMD, Intel, Nvidia; Fed Minutes - Barron's
source_articles.body:
LIVE
Dow Set to Open Up Ahead of Fed Minutes
S&P 500 and Nasdaq futures are also rising in premarket trading Wednesday.
Last Updated:
Oct. 8, 2025 at 5:39 AM ET
Key Events
Pinned Post
Stock futures were edging up after the artificial-intelligence rally came to an abrupt halt in the previous session. Markets are looking for catalysts amid a lack of economic data while the U.S. government shutdown drags on, which means today’s minutes from last month’s Federal Reserve monetary policy meeting may carry even more weight than usual.
Dow Jones Industrial Index futures were up 70 points in Tuesday’s premarket, or 0.1%. The S&P 500 was rising 0.2% while the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 was up 0.3%.
The S&P 500 fell for the first time in more than a week Tuesday as Wall Street pumped the brakes after a series of record highs in what looked like signs of buyer exhaustion. The Dow and Nasdaq also finished the session lower.
The continuing government shutdown means there is a vacuum of economic data on which the Fed usually depends to inform its decisions. That leaves traders looking for any other signs from the central bank about its intentions on interest rates.
There were mixed messages yesterday that may have contributed to the market malaise. Fed Gov. Stephen Miran said his expectations for a limited tariff impact on inflation mean the central bank can keep easing monetary policy. While Fed Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari warned that any drastic rate cuts would risk stoking prices.
However, today’s minutes from the Federal Open Market Committee could offer something more concrete. The central bank cut rates by a quarter point at the last meeting with Miran, President Donald Trump’s pick for the Fed board, the lone dissenting voice. Market watchers will look for any indication from other members that they advocate a further loosening of monetary policy.
“Market bulls benefited significantly in the past few days amidst a lack of economic figures, however, as multibillion dollar AI deals strengthened sentiment regarding modern technology’s growth potential. While that exuberance has quelled, further upside may emerge from Fed speakers acknowledging that decelerating labor conditions warrant imminent rate cuts across several meetings,” wrote Jose Torres, senior economist at Interactive Brokers.
Among equities, tech will also remain in focus. The giants of the sector led markets lower Tuesday amid a report that cloud margins from software maker Oracle are below many estimates. Meantime, Tesla stock sank over 4% after the car maker introduced new versions of its top-selling models priced at under $40,000, with critics saying the lower-price models are too expensive to convert buyers to the brand.
AI continues to be the hot topic but as the earnings season gets going many of the market-moving tech titans don’t report until the end of the month. PepsiCo and Delta Airlines post results tomorrow, which could give an indication of the health of the consumer and Americans’ spending power in the wake of President Donald Trump’s tariffs. Any indication of the strength of the economy will likely be amplified by markets in the absence of official numbers.
Gold continued to be the big winner amid political uncertainty as the price of the precious metal settled above $4,000 for the first time. The haven asset has jumped more than 50% this year in the face of uncertainties over global trade, the Federal Reserve’s independence, and U.S. fiscal stability. It was rising again early Wednesday, up 1.2% in early trade.
Elsewhere, bonds rose as a $58 billion Treasury sale drew solid demand but the benchmark 10-year was paring back on Wednesday—edging lower by up to 0.4 basis points, according to Tradeweb data.

source_articles.title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 Futures Tick Higher After 7-Day Rally Snaps — Traders Eye Fed Signals As Shutdown Uncertainty Lingers - Stocktwits
source_articles.body:
Advertisement|Remove ads.
U.S. stocks appear on track to shake off Tuesday’s losses, with the major index futures all trading higher late in the day. Uncertainty over the government shutdown persisted, with President Donald Trump considering mass layoffs as a means to rein in spending.
The ongoing artificial intelligence (AI) deal news flow and investments will likely provide an offsetting impact. A Bloomberg report, citing people familiar with the matter, stated that Nvidia would invest $2 billion in Elon Musk-led AI startup xAI as part of the latter’s latest funding round.
Fund manager Louis Navellier shrugged off talks of an AI bubble burst like the one seen in 1999, reasoning that this time around, the players are huge companies with healthy balance sheets and strong cash flow.
As of 11 p.m. ET on Tuesday, the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 futures rose 0.14% and 0.19%, respectively, and the Dow futures were up a more modest 0.10%. The Russell 2000 futures climbed 0.25%.
The S&P 500 Index snapped a seven-session winning streak on Tuesday as traders, using the ongoing shutdown and data showing rising inflation expectations, booked profits on recent gains. The Russell 2000 Index fell by the most (down 1.12%), dragged down by concerns about the trajectory of interest rates. Some heavily-weighted stocks, including Oracle (ORCL), Nvidia (NVDA) and Tesla (TSLA), fell sharply, denting sentiment toward the tech sector.
The SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY), an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the S&P 500 Index, and the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) slipped 0.37% and 0.53%, respectively. The SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF Trust (DIA) moved down 0.19%, while the iShares Russell 2000 ETF (IWM) slumped 1.07%.
Navellier conceded that the market breadth and power need to improve overall, but he does not subscribe to the theory of a stock market bubble. The fund manager said traders can confidently invest in stocks as long as earnings estimates continue to move northward and the Fed keeps lowering rates.
On the economic front, the minutes of the Federal Reserve’s September rate-setting meeting, in which the central bank resumed its cuts, will be released at 2 p.m. ET. Traders will likely sift through the report for cues on the Fed’s future course of action. More Fed speakers will be in action on Wednesday, including St. Louis Fed’s Alberto Musalem (9:20 p.m. ET), Fed Governor Michael Barr (9:30 p.m. ET and 5:45 p.m. ET), Minneapolis Neel Kashkari (3:15 p.m. ET), and Chicago Fed’s Austan Goolsbee (7:15 p.m. ET).
AZZ, Inc. (AZZ) is scheduled to report its financial results after the market closes.
Crude oil extended its gains in Wednesday’s Asian session, and gold futures are continuing their record run, with the yellow metal trading past the $4,000 psychological barrier. The U.S. 10-year Treasury note yield ticked up in the Asian session after slipping 3.5 basis points on Tuesday. The dollar has firmed up against most major currencies.
Major Asian markets traded mixed, with the Japanese, Indonesian, and New Zealand markets recording gains, while the Hong Kong and Taiwanese markets fell sharply. China and South Korea remained closed for public holidays.
For updates and corrections, email newsroom[at]stocktwits[dot]com.

source_articles.title: Top of the DB tree: behold the new 690bhp Aston Martin DB12 S - Top Gear
source_articles.body:
Top of the DB tree: behold the new 690bhp Aston Martin DB12 S
Aston gives its big bad GT car more power and more noise
This is the shiny new Aston Martin DB12 S, where S stands for ‘Sorry if you went ahead and bought a standard DB12’. For that one little letter adds boons of power, pointiness and most importantly, noise.
It’s now the fastest and most powerful iteration of the lovely DB12, via a 19bhp boost to the 4.0-litre AMG V8 lurking under that vast bonnet. So where the not-at-all-regular regular car churned out 671bhp, this one’s got 690bhp.
Torque remains unchanged at 590lb ft, but thanks to powertrain tweaks, launch control and gearshift times have both been cut, meaning 0-62mph now takes just 3.5s vs 3.6s in the non-S DB12. One entire tenth! What will you do with all that time?
Maybe… revel in that biturbo V8. Aston’s given the DB12 S a quad-pipe stainless steel exhaust system “tuned to accentuate the engine frequencies throughout the rev range for added depth and potency”. Yes, we’ll always miss the snarling old nat-asp 6.0-litre Aston V12, but this is 2025 – let’s just celebrate what we can, where we can, m’kay.
Said exhaust cuts the DB12’s weight by a considerable 11.7kg and adds 1.5dB of Good Noise, while further tweaks include a more “progressive” throttle pedal feel (it recycles and cares for the environment, maybe?)
Meanwhile, new settings for the Bilstein DTX dampers (less roll and pitch), tweaked camber/toe/castor settings, and a stiffer rear anti-roll bar join other screws Aston has tightened in the DB12’s chassis. Like tweaking the steering and e-diff to allow use of the throttle “earlier in the corner for maximum satisfaction from corner entry to exit”. Yup, Aston wants you to get lairy.
Carbon ceramic brakes arrive as standard fit, and they’re bigger and lighter (they alone save 27kg of unsprung weight versus the DB12’s steel setup). Driver assists have also been sent to finishing school, while the suit’s been tweaked.
You’ll spot the new front splitter and bonnet louvres – functional as well as another ‘outta my way, puny non-S DB12’ sign – gloss black sills, lots of S badges, a new rear diffuser, those pipes, and a new rear spoiler. Inside you’re offered three trims laid over the very adjustable sports seats, while there’s the option to option the heck out of it. Just ask Q nicely.

source_articles.title: Fresh Look: Aston Martin Puts the S Back on Top With the 2026 DB12 S - MotorTrend
source_articles.body:
Fresh Look: Aston Martin Puts the S Back on Top With the 2026 DB12 S
With nearly 700 horsepower on tap, the 2026 DB12 S moves the high-performance coupe to the apex of Aston Martin's V-8 food chain.
It was inevitable Aston Martin would bring an S variant to its latest DB12, and the company gave it more power and less weight to pump up its performance potential. Equipped with a 4.0-liter twin-turbo V-8 with extra power compared to the regular DB12, the 2026 Aston Martin DB12 S promises to deliver the big bangs its owners crave without giving up on the comforts and refinement they equally expect.
The upgraded 4.0-liter twin-turbo V-8 means the 2026 Aston Martin DB12 S screams out of the gate with 690 hp. That is an improvement of nearly 20 hp from the standard DB12 while producing the same 590 lb-ft of torque from 3,000–6,000 rpm. In combination with a new launch control system, Aston claims the DB12 S will accelerate to 60 mph in just 3.4 seconds, or a scant 0.1-second quicker than the non-S version. Meanwhile, the sound it makes from its quad-tip exhaust boosts the noise level by 1.5 decibels, and the exhaust's titanium construction removes around 26 pounds from the standard DB12 system.
Acceleration off the line might not be noticeably better through the seat of the driver's pants, but once out of the gate and into the first turn, Aston says, that driver will feel a difference in gas-pedal feel thanks to a S-specific throttle map, as well as 50-percent quicker shifts. The carmaker also promises increased braking performance thanks to standard carbon-ceramic brakes. The additional thermal capacity of carbon-ceramic brakes allows drivers to get on the stoppers later and repeatedly without fade, and Aston says the 16-inch front and 14-inch rear rotors provide more linear brake response and consistent feel. There is also the bonus of losing close to 60 pounds of total unspung mass compared to steel brakes, which should aid ride quality and create better steering feel and handling. The handling is improved further by a standard electronic differential and revised power-assist calibration in the steering, anti-lock braking, and stability-control systems. The 2026 Aston Martin DB12 S chassis also sees improvement thanks to software changes for the car's Bilstein DTX dampers. Working in collaboration with stiffer anti-roll bars, the new damper behavior allegedly improves the car's stability during roll and pitch moments, while toe- and castor-geometry settings aim to improve front-end feel and driver confidence.
Outside, the new DB12 S features function alongside form by utilizing improved downforce and airflow guidance with an overall assertive design in the body. It all starts with a new dual-element front splitter, while the hood vents are improved to allow better airflow and can be finished in gloss black or with exposed carbon fiber. Those vents help extract the hot air coming from the turbo's hot-V configuration. The DB12 S' body also features new side sills that follow the lines created by the new splitter and feature gloss-black trim additions. Out back, the new soundtrack should match the high-performance looks and functionality of the fixed rear spoiler. Below is an all-new matching rear diffuser Aston says works with that spoiler to further reduce rear-end lift.
Inside, the 2026 Aston Martin DB12 S envelops you with many options for interior colors and features, with Accelerate leather and Alcantara trim, Inspire S semi-aniline leather with Alcantara trim, and Inspire S in full semi-aniline leather. These new interior treatments feature things like embossed and debossed Aston Martin logos on the headrests. For the Inspire S packages, S Herringbone quilting with micro-perforations create a custom look to contrast with the Alcantara headliner. You can also order your DB12 S with an Alcantara heated sports steering wheel, and you have the choice of either the standard 16-way Sport Plus electric seats or you can reduce weight

source_articles.title: Investigation launched after South Carolina judge﻿’s house burns down - MSNBC News
source_articles.body:
UPDATE (Oct. 6, 2025, 6:18 p.m. ET): The South Carolina Law Enforcement Division said enforcement officials said Monday afternoon that there is no initial evidence to indicate the fire was intentionally set. The investigation remains ongoing.
Authorities are investigating a fire that destroyed the island home of a longtime South Carolina judge and her husband, a former state lawmaker.
The house, in a gated community on the coast in Edisto Beach (about 50 miles southwest of Charleston), belongs to state Circuit Judge Diane Goodstein and her husband, former Democratic state Sen. Arnold Goodstein.
Saturday’s fire comes one month after Judge Goodstein temporarily blocked the state from handing the Justice Department the personal data of millions of voters. The state Supreme Court overturned her ruling shortly after.
Videos showed a large blaze and clouds of smoke engulfing the three-story home. Fire officials said people had to be rescued from the backyard by kayak.
The judge, who has served on the bench since 1998, was walking her dogs at the time, but her husband was home and jumped out the back to escape, a neighbor told The Post and Courier.
The cause of the fire is not yet known. The South Carolina Law Enforcement Division, which is leading the investigation, told MSNBC that the probe is “active and ongoing.”

market_summary: The JPN225 (Nikkei Average) declined for the first time in five days, closing at 47,734.99 amid profit-taking and concerns over short-term overheating, erasing earlier bargain-hunting gains. The TOPIX extended its rally to a fourth consecutive day, hitting record highs, while cross-asset signals suggested caution, with gold prices surging and Nikkei 225 futures seeing reduced volume and open interest. Technical weakness emerged as the index fell below key levels following its post-gain retracement, though broader market resilience was noted in select sectors. Mixed sector performance and divergent regional equity trends (Asia dipped, Europe opened higher) indicated uneven investor sentiment.\n\n**Overall Market Sentiment:** Negative

source_articles.title: The Nikkei Average fell by 215 yen, marking its first decline in five days amid caution over short-term overheating = Afternoon session on the 8th. - 富途牛牛
source_articles.body:
In the afternoon session eight days later, the Nikkei Stock Average fell by 215 yen and 89 sen to close at 47,734.99, marking its first decline in five days. Meanwhile, the TOPIX (Tokyo Stock Price Index) rose by 7.75 points to close at 3,235.66, extending its gains for the fourth consecutive day and setting a new record closing high for the third straight session. In the U.S. market on the 7th, the NY Dow continued its decline, while the Nasdaq Composite Index also reversed its upward trend. Japanese stocks initially saw strong selling pressure due to a pullback following sharp gains from recent trading activity. Although there was some recovery attributed to bargain hunting, upside buying remained limited. Subsequently, amid concerns about short-term overheating, the Nikkei Average remained subdued and dropped by 222.61 yen to 47,728.27 at 3:15 PM. Towards the end of trading, the index weakened further due to profit-taking after a streak of gains. The USD/JPY exchange rate remained range-bound around the 152.40-yen level.
The trading volume on the Tokyo Stock Exchange's Prime Market amounted to 2.21874 billion shares, with a total trading value of 5.8674 trillion yen. Among the listed issues, 557 stocks advanced, 999 declined, and 60 remained unchanged.
Among all 33 industry sectors, 19 declined and 14 advanced. Rubber product stocks such as Bridgestone (5108.T) and Hama Gomu (5101.T), as well as precision equipment stocks like Terumo (4543.T) and HOYA (7741.T), experienced declines. Pulp and paper stocks including Oji Holdings (3861.T) and Nippon Paper (3863.T), along with chemical stocks such as Shin-Etsu Chemical (4063.T) and Fujifilm Holdings (4901.T), were also weak. Information and communication stocks like KDDI (9433.T) and SoftBank Group (9984.T), as well as steel stocks including Nippon Steel (5401.T) and JFE Holdings (5411.T), showed softness. Real estate stocks like Mitsui Fudosan (8801.T) and Mitsubishi Estate (8802.T), along with land transportation stocks such as Tokyu Corporation (9005.T) and Central Japan Railway Company (9022.T), also underperformed. On the other hand, non-ferrous metal stocks like Furukawa Electric (5801.T) and Fujikura (5803.T), as well as marine products and agriculture stocks including Nissui (1332.T) and Sakata Seed (1377.T), performed strongly.
Elsewhere, Parco GH (2726.T), Ichigo (2337.T), M&A Research Institute (9552.T), Sunwells (9229.T), and TBASE (3415.T) declined. Conversely, Warabe-ya Nihon (2918.T), LinkUG (4446.T), Orion Breweries (409A.T), Sakata Seed (1377.T), and Mitsubishi Steel (5632.T) advanced.
Provided by: Wealth Advisor Co.

source_articles.body:
World shares are mixed after US stocks retreat, while gold surges higher
Shares have opened higher in Europe but retreated in Asia after U.S. stocks sank to their first loss in eight days.
The price of gold, which topped $4,000 per ounce for the first time on Tuesday, continued to rise, trading up nearly $58 at $4,062.10.
